also known as the times symbol (*)', '=equals sign - Used to show equality between two values in mathematics and programming languages', '>greater than sign - Represents an inequality greater than another value (e.g., 5 > 3)', '<less than sign - Indicates that one value is lesser than the other (e.g., 2 < 4)', '{curly brackets} or {} - Used to denote grouping, sets, and in some programming languages for blocks of code', '[square brackets] or [] - Often used as a placeholder for variables, lists, or comments in computer codes;
